N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6660.9 - Procedures for ombudsman access to facilities and residents

State Regulations
(a) Access to
long-term care facilities. An ombudsman shall have authority to enter all
long-term care facilities at any time during a facility's regular business
hours or regular visiting hours, and at any other time when access may be
required by the circumstances to be investigated and shall have access to all
residents and/or the resident representative to perform all functions and
duties enumerated herein. (b) An
ombudsman seeking access to a long-term care facility or resident of a
long-term care facility shall: (1)
upon a
staff member's request, identify himself or herself; (2)
upon a staff member's request, show the
ombudsman identification card issued by the office of the state long-term care
ombudsman; and
(3)
comply with the
facility's procedures for signing in and out of the facility. (c) Noninterference. No long-term
care facility, other entity or individual shall: (1)
refuse to permit an ombudsman entry into
such facility, interfere with, refuse to cooperate with, or retaliate against
an ombudsman carrying out their mandated duties and responsibilities set forth
in this section and any regulations promulgated pursuant thereto; (2)
refuse to permit residents or staff to
communicate freely and privately with an ombudsman; or
(3)
retaliate against any resident, resident
representative, complainant, or staff member for filing a complaint with, providing information to, or otherwise cooperating with any
ombudsman. Notes
